sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: STERCULIA, in botany : A genus of plants belonging to the claſs of monœcia, and order of monodelphia; and in the natural ſyſtem under the 38th order, tricocceæ. The male calyx is quinquepartite ; there is no corolla, but there are 15 filaments. The female calyx is quinquepartite ; there is no corolla ; the germen is placed on a pillar, and the capſule is quinquelocular, and many- ſeeded. There are three ſpecies, the balanghas, foetida, and platanifolium, all foreign plants.
